1.text: Strain 2 cups (400 g) of sushi rice under running water.

2.text: Add water and rice to a saucepan in a 3:2 ratio.

3.text: Cook the rice for 10 minutes after the water boils.

4.text: Mix a small amount of salt, sugar, and rice vinegar together.

5.text: Arrange the rice onto a cooking tray or bowl so it can cool.

6.text: Mix the vinegar solution into the cooling rice to give it flavor.

7.text: Select raw tuna or salmon for an authentic sushi roll.

8.text: Go for cooked eel or crab if you don’t like raw fish.

9.text: Rub oily fish with sea salt and vinegar to enhance their flavor.

10.text: Use vegetables like cucumbers and carrots to add texture to your roll.

11.text: Choose crab and tuna without bits of shell or sinew.

12.text: Chop fresh fish into 4 by 0.25 in (10.16 by 0.64 cm) long strips.

13.text: Cut fresh vegetables in thin, vertical slices.

14.text: Slice fresh avocado into 0.25 in (0.64 cm) thick pieces.

15.text: Lay 1 piece of nori onto a bamboo mat.

16.text: Layer ½ to 1 cup (100-200 g) of sushi rice over the nori sheet.

17.text: Arrange your ingredients lengthwise on top of the rice.

18.text: Roll up the bamboo mat so only 0.25 to 1 inch (0.64 to 2.54 cm) of nori is visible.

19.text: Squeeze the top and sides of the bamboo mat to form the sushi roll.

20.text: Unroll the bamboo and remove the sushi.

21.text: Slice the sushi into 6 equally-sized pieces.
